meaningMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an い on the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. What's the adjective form of <kanji>dull</kanji>? It's <vocabulary>dull</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: To remember the reading, think about how when you're i<reading>neb</reading>riated (にぶ) you need to use a <vocabulary>dull</vocabulary> knife. The にぶい reading talks about a thing that is dull. For のろい, which refers to a dull mind (someone who's <vocabulary>thickheaded</vocabulary>). Think about a <reading>Nor</reading>se (のろ) God, the God of dullbrains.
